3KdthSe2gY9I4pn7kiGhKA.text: I've had both a burger and a salad here now, and I have to be honest while it isn't bad food it definitely isn't anything outstanding. The salad is basically $9 to have someone the EnP salad bar in a bowl and the burger was kind of a bland underwhelming sandwich. I do like the location and I like that i can order a salad and pick it up on the way home when I'm in a pinch for dinner, but I wish the quality of the items for the salads were a little higher. The service here has been excellent each time I've been and their sodas are admittedly really good. I just wish for a standalone EnP concept they'd up the quality a little bit.

RgK04yhxpHUcGiNqk2aR4A.text: I went with two of my friends yesterday as they have never been to "Hello Bistro" before. I ordered a salad and they both ordered a veggie burger each. The food was fantastic. The burgers took forever to be brought to our table. I started to eat my salad as I didn't want it to get soggy. I was almost done with my salad when they got their food. The point of dinner was to eat together and have fun but they had to watch me eat the whole time. Pick it up hello bistro!

d5YSHy6qABSds2oK208fwg.text: Worth the visit for the salads!  The other posts here saying it's just like Eat n Park are sadly mistaken.  There are way more toppings to pick from, everything is super fresh, and there is a great dressing selection.  They have pre selected salads you can order but you're better off making your own.  I highly recommend the chicken with the fiesta seasoning.

y-MJcx1SJYmE2X09Aj6DSw.text: First of all, I am extremely disappointed in one of my favorite places to go grab a quick and healthy salad at because of a staff member. I usually come once a week for lunch to pick up Cobb salads ( without the blue cheese, tomato, and diced egg, due to dislike and being allergic to some of those ingredients) for both my sister and I. We usually have no problems at all, it's quick and easy with friendly staff..  this time was different and really got everyone's attention in the whole restaurant who were about to order and were already eating... when I ordered the two Cobb salads without the blue cheese, tomatoes and eggs, the staff member Crystal instantly shot me down and said I can not order that because I'm removing three ingredient and that "I'm better off making my own salad" in a very rude and snarky attitude. I told her I come here every week ordering the same thing and they make it with no problems .. she continued to raise her voice to me in a yelling manner (now everyone is staring at her in the whole restaurant) saying I "don't understand" and that I can only substitute or remove only one ingredient from the specialty salads .. I understand that if it a policy but it has never address to me in all of the 10 plus times I have ordered at this restaurant.. nor is it posted anywhere in the restaurant or on the menu that I ordered from today.. even other employees who were working at the time apologized for her outrages unprofessional behavior and tone while talking to a customer... I am so upset that a business I love to eat at often hires such an unprofessional rude staff member

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

e9nG1TaDUkrhPojb_807vg.text: My husband and I went for lunch and it was busy.  The food was good, but the main complaint is the noise factor.  So much clatter with the staff preparing the food.  Sounded like they were throwing things around.  It was not relaxing at all.

NpbpvcwOtYCOjiaz6CT8KA.text: So this is my first visit to hello Bistro. I gave one star because the Boylan bottling soda was excellent. But, that's all that was good. Tomato soup was watered down Campbell's.  I had the tandoori chicken arugula salad. I am not exaggerating when I tell you that there was possibly half an ounce of chicken. The arugula was not entirely  fresh, plenty of yellow wilted mixed . And probably 1/2 oz. of raw beets. $9 of wilted greens. If this is eat n park's version of healthy eating, they need to go back to the drawing board.

dyuPd-m5iiz9fiT3AXttdg.text: This place is slow, pretentious, and has about four fifteen year olds who are just aloof and are clearly family members of the "manager." Also this place tends to be where the desperate housewives of the south hills come to have their salads. I think they need a reminder that it's eat n' park.

Ks6LaQoRXxKUmaAj19tGPg.text: i honestly love this place so much and i think it's better than any other of these healthy cafes around here (panera isn't good sorry.) but i have to say that i've only had one good experience with the customer service and i wish i had her name but she had a louis belt which was cute but anyways... after going in tonight i am hesitant to go back. the young boy who took my order told me he wasnt going to give me spinach because it would be difficult to get just that since it's mixed in with the kale and i was okay with a little bit of kale but a girl walked over and took the bowl out of his hands and put just spinach and i thanked the both of them because it was a picky order but i still am a paying customer. From there on out the girl gave me attitude and barely spoke when i was asking questions about the chicken. She asked if my order was to go and i told her yes and she put a lid on the bowl and slammed it on to the counter and walked over to her co workers and was angry and seemed annoyed and i told her to have a nice night but was ignored. I don't understand what the issue was but a major thumbs down on this hello trip. :/

lMMBk1DKokKdunCh_SOxOw.text: We had salads and sandwiches for lunch when we were here.  My husband had the Pot roast sandwich, and said it was good.  My daughter had the Greek Salad which looked fantastic!  I had the pick your own toppings salad and would ABSOLUTELY recommend you order this.  You can get it with a meat option, or without (I did chicken)and there has to be about 50 different choices of veggies and other toppings.  Even the lettuce options were plentiful and fresh.  I want to say there were 10-15 dressings to choose from as well.  Also, they chop it all for you and ask how you want it chopped.  Very clean, lots of seating inside and fresh food :)

DuVNjGhdmPvJsxXSU_Nh5Q.text: I'm a frequent guest at other Hello Bistro locations and today was my first time at this new location. First off, the avocado I ordered was missing-- kinda annoying because you pay extra but whatever. There was also barely any of the other items I ordered in it.. one carrot, little to no quinoa, etc. what really turned me off is there was a few random pieces of ham and chicken, none of which I ordered. I pretty much stopped eating after that. I think I'll go to Whole Foods next door the next time I'm crazy a good salad.

mff1MgmHSKSE8Wcf2h5FPg.text: How many times can Eat n Park try another concept using the same old food?  If you are going to serve the same soup, burgers, and salad bar why not call it Eat n Park.  I understand that they are trying to open new outlets and different concepts, but it if you never change the ingredients why bother.  My wife and I stopped on our way to Target to pick up a few things.  She ordered the Caprese grilled cheese sandwich and fries.  After reviewing the menu and seeing all the speciality burgers I began to think that their burger must be something special. I also ordered a bowl of chicken noodle soup, I love soup.  My burger came without any condiments, I had to go up to the counter to ask for mayo, and the burger tasted slightly better than the frozen ones you get from Costco.  Oh, and soup is the same chicken noodle you get at Eat n Park, which is not bad, but like I stated before if I wanted to eat at Eat n Park it's a five-minute drive down the street.     Do not be tricked, if you want  Eat n Park level food, go to an Eat n Park.

p1O_hrTljo3zRjlvXJHu4A.text: Our family frequently likes salads for lunch and dinner. Aside from the excellent burgers and steak options, the made to order salad bar  is simply over the top. Not only are all the ingredients custom selected, they are thoroughly mixed and chopped just the way you prefer.  Dressings are tossed into the salad making a fully uniform blend that is simply scrumptious. There are a series of meat options with various preparations also available to include with your salad.  Hello Bistro is a must try at the first opportunity.

yiMVv8YTn0Z2ijQZH6OnyA.text: Our family of 4 has been here 4 times in the first few weeks and love it. Great addition to the south hills!

nj-FX3uQ7jYOZnxX8iZNjg.text: I have been twice now.  The salads are good, but it is a salad and an expensive salad.  Went today and asked for soup, counter person wasn't either understanding or rude- not sure which.  I asked if they had it and she just kept holding up to go containers showing me that they have containers.  Never could get an answer, I'm assuming the containers represent that you can get soup to go.  The menu says they have "EnP soup"- maybe they get a couple from Eat n Park and bring them over.  Panera soup way better than Eat n Park and the same price as Hello Bistro.  Husband got a sandwich that was soggy but fries were good.  Restaurant is clean and modern, overall take- pricey with sub-par service and average food.

umtoBu2VEeyhDTKqNPHqqg.text: I like the concept, but the execution needs work. This place is so loud that not only did the employee get my order wrong (because she couldn't hear me), but my friend and I were barely able to have a conversation. Afterwards, we saw friends who gave us a tip: If you order one of the suggested salad combinations, it's more expensive than creating one (even with the same ingredients). The fresh-cut fries looked and smelled amazing, but it's disappointing that they're not made in a dedicated fryer (so people who have to eat gluten free will be left out).

LC-t9nXCsS10QX04JDqulA.text: Please empty the trash, have your employees wear food gloves & stop touching their own hair.   Seemed like the employees were just hanging out, doing their own thing and not working as a food handler.  I love the concept, I want this to be good, but it is not.  Never saw an E&P ran like this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. The place was empty, no customers, a handful of employees standing around. How about taking out the trash.

KLkE-13dL6gndTkMMvXgWw.text: The employees work their butts off, are always on their feet, and do an amazing job. The people who stood out the most to be were two girls working at the salad bar I asked for their names and they told me they were Leigha and Lexi. I am a big hello bistro fan and I highly recommend. I hope to see these girls there again. They helped me pick the best choice as it was my first visit to the bistro. It was a lovely sunday afternoon and service was fast and these girls were polite and got my order exactly right!

FG8eyyPdhpSAMgyOoyY8Pw.text: I am not typically one to leave bad reviews but the last two times I have come here my sandwiches have been disgusting. I have no complaints about the soups and salads but I have given up on the sandwiches. Always soggy within minutes of ordering.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Caprese Grilled Cheese that just fell apart when I picked it up.

2Jb1hlAx8mhZwT4krvz_gw.text: Found the Thai Peanut Salmon salad fresh and refreshing. At first I thought there weren't many toppings, but as I ate I saw they were towards the bottom of the bowl. Overall I was impressed with the menu. We need more healthy eateries in the South Hills.  One disappointment was the to-go dressing cup was small. For spending over $10 on a salad, it stinks to run out before you're done eating.  Excited to go back and try a burger.

luTd_ozl4kF7T12PTWMWtQ.text: I frequent this Hello Bistro and just had a salad there today. I've never seen the place so filthy. Every surface near the salad bar was really dirty. The bathroom was awful. Many items in the bar were empty. Not a happy customer today!

lGVlgaAe34qcvJHw_nTs2g.text: The food is very tasty, but the lobby is always dirty and our order is never right. We don't even order custom salads, everything we get is off of the predesigned menu. We ordered 2 salads, a burger with fries, and a kids meal with a grilled cheese. We got the wrong burger, two kids meals, one happened to be right, and only one salad. The salad was even wrong, no blue cheese as listed on the menu, and the salad was dressed, after we asked for it on the side. Basically, we got someone else's order. We of course realize this after we get home and have a hungry toddler.

FwFlaZcKbB54Y4yPEeidyg.text: Concept is great! Employees are all young and are not supervised. Found two hairs in salad and was treated poorly by the staff. It's a shame. This place could be awesome.

iVsr37Xzgn5VHSKiYCSwLA.text: Sometime the service can be a bit slow, but - you can't really find a better value for what you get anywhere else. Nowhere in the Pgh area can you load a bowl full of unlimited topping to go and not have it by weight.

uyG5KyqTrBrfaPoJGocoLg.text: Hello Bistro was very inviting and clean. The prices are very reasonable and portions are decent. I ordered a salad that I couldn't even finish and chicken noodle soup that is Eat n Park's recipe. What I liked the most were the healthy options that they had and the option for them to build your own salad with fresh ingredients. There fountain drink dispenser also had different flavors like cream soda and ginger ale. Yum. Give this place a try!

q_IL-C-BaxmmeUNOppFqZw.text: The service was good and the food was great. I love the way they make their salads. I probably should have had one of those - they look so delicious!

VEMm5qJ7c6RpA4qlW1OUlQ.text: The food is fine, but it takes FOREVER.  I'm currently at 23 minutes for a burger and a cup of soup and still patiently waiting. It's like this every time. I should have remembered and not come back.

jzDIJqXFbqzosDb59W31BA.text: Very bad service. My friend and I went today and ordered a autumn apple salad and a cup of tomato soup. Two things, two.  We waited a half hour and we had to go ask where our food was. When the food came out  the soup was cold and we just asked for a refund at that point. We will not be back.

yl9NDLSaWNLPDtF_RhQy9A.text: Hello Bistro is Eat n Park's entry into what they call "fast casual" food concept. The menu consists of 3 main items-salads, burgers, and cheese. You can have your salad made to order or choose one of their prepared salads or one of their seasonal specials. I noticed the strawberry salad bears a strong resemblance to the same one currently at Eat n Park. I was told of some subtle differences that this salad has and the regular Eat n Park doesn't.  They have a variety of different hamburgers including the famous superburger that the Eat n Park chain has. There is a limited selection of cheese for sandwiches. My husband decided to order the superburger with fries. He was given a number so that it could be brought out to him. I decided to try the build your own salad. You pay upfront for this first before they pull the items to build your salad. Certain items are extra such as chicken, shrimp, and avocado. You start by picking the base greens and then you get an unlimited choice of various toppings. You tell them what you want and they will pull your selections into your prep bowl. They did have items such as quinoa as a topping which I thought was different. I like quinoa but it gets mixed in the salad along with everything else.  Then they will mix it up and serve it to you in a huge plastic bowl similar to what you would get at Brugger's bagels.  I chose as my base kale and spinach and had them add a fair amount of my favorite vegetables, The chicken was prepared different ways so you could choose the time you wanted. I went with that. I saw that they had green ice tea available in addition to peach ice tea. If you want a lemon however, then you must ask for it while you are waiting for your salad to be prepared. They also will ask you how much or how little dressing of your choice you want before mixing it all together.  I finally got my finished salad and went back to join my husband. He told me his superburger tasted a bit greasy. The fries come bagged even though we had decided to eat in. I tasted a couple and again nothing particularly outstanding about it. My salad was fair as well. My kale was crunchy and there was a lot of it!  The manager Andy came over to chat with us and I got the opportunity to learn how their concept works. They do offer some farm to table items and compared to Eat n Park's famous salad bar, they offer more here. On the contrary however, when you go to Eat n Park and order the salad bar, if you don't like what is on it then you can get a fresh plate and start again. He also explained that the fries always come bagged since their concept is fast casual.  I did ask about some of the pastries I found on the bar since all they were selling here were mini smiley cookies. He explained to me that since they don't have a bakery they can't carry the same mini bear claws or muffins I normally find over there. They will be carrying soups like tomato and chicken noodle in the fall. Don't look for chili. It is not a popular item here.  I did get the opportunity afterwards to talk a little with the chef and learn how some of the food is prepared. The place was fairly packed by the time we left. Outdoor seating is available. They are just a little more expensive than Eat n Park. They will be opening up another Hello Bistro on Washington Road in Mt. Lebanon in the near future.  The eatery is located right in the center of the upper part of the new strip mall off of Siena Dr and right around the corner from the Porch at Siena. It is a different concept having them prepare it for me. Nevertheless, I probably will return to the regular Eat n Park for their soup and salad bar where I can make it up any way I choose for a bit less money.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. They serve your fries in a bag even if you are eating in
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Finished salad
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Super burger

Hqj3hkD9aa5qjMzNaz6ugg.text: Eat-n-park has the south hills locked down! With their flag ship stores and now the addition of the Porch and Hello Bistro, you can't miss!And in a good way! What a great concept! Fresh food at great prices, in a laid back fun setting. The sandwiches and burgers are great! Made fresh to order. The hand cut fries are incredible and for 2$ you get a sack of them!! The salad set up is amazing! Made to order then you pick the fix-ins and they mix it, chop it, and serve it up! Great drinks in the fountain by Bolen and the milkshakes are amazing also. They setting is fun a open with tables and high seating. Plus an outdoor section, which pittsburgh restaurants need to get on Board with more! People like to sit outside to eat. Period!  The prices can't be beat either, for lunch for two with drinks to be under 20$, you have to love that!

dBjWUYWnQKCoj8-yoDevIg.text: Poor service. Took 35 minutes to get food. Tomato Soup was watery. Chicken Noodle Soup was average. Very similar Eat N' Park's chicken noodle soup. Grilled Cheese Sandwiches were good. Ham Burger was slightly above average. Fries are average "fresh-cut", little greasy & a little soggy.

GXm7-rn21ZoGNAR1nB2N8A.text: The world's grossest salad bar. They have apparently decided to prioritize phone orders and make the in-person customers wait. So there we stood watching them slop together phone orders while ignoring our orders. The floor and countertops were disgusting with food all over them. They were hurrying to make the orders so quickly that they were slopping individual ingredients from one bin to another.  Using the same salad bowl to mix salad after salad after salad, hope you weren't allergic to something. No sense customizing your order. We asked for the manager to get a refund and here she refunded our money and never even asked why. You better order over the phone, because if you saw how dirty it is in person, you'd never be able to eat here again.

2ryksIcAuwZS9deT_q_lKw.text: I like their food, but this particular location needs to get their act together. The staff is young and disorganized. Total disaster getting a simple order.

ORlE6SAe603Skiq3H12_3g.text: I have visited multiple hello bistro locations and have always had a pleasant experience. This was a great addition to the south hills! Made to order salads with unlimited toppings! So many things to choose from. I will say the service was a little slow today, but it seemed to be because this is a brand new location and there was a lot of employee training going on. The employees were all so friendly and the restaurant was unbelievably clean. I plan to be a regular now that it's closer to my house!

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Salads by you. Full to the brim! Great deal for your money.

IWxj0qgbu3wSLeiCoKH7jQ.text: I enjoyed my lunch here at hello bistro. They have delicious food and our waiter was very kind.

TXliysx7kp3tekwbdD-A7w.text: I was pretty excited when this place was introduced to the south hills, as it seemed like the kind of establishment to carry some vegan options. I was pretty wrong besides the veggie burger and some of the salads, but I guess I shouldn't have gotten my hopes up! anyways, I tried the quinoa avocado salad but I guess someone literally just forgot the avocado. so I paid $7 for a salad that was 90% kale, 5% quinoa, and 5% red peppers. Definitely not what I ordered, really disappointing

nt3vPhmw3iOm62v6IzKdcA.text: Great place for a quick lunch especially if you like chopped salad. Other menu items such as burgers, grilled cheese, fries also available but I think the salad is their main deal.   You can customize your entire salad from type of lettuce to protein and tons of topping options. They chopped it in front of you and then enjoy! Large portion size which is always too much for me to finish! If you don't like to customize your own, they have salads on the menu to choose from as well. I usually get salad but I've had the veggie burger as well. I would skip this next time though as it didn't hold any shape and was just mushy.   Service is always pretty quick and prices inexpensive. I've seen it get a little backed up when it gets busy around lunch however, and I've seen about a 10 minute wait at the salad chopping station. Indoor and limited outdoor seating. I'll certainly eat here again when I want a good salad.

LsulltlZMyfL86CIVga2yQ.text: Hello Bistro was one of my favorite places to go for dinner in Oakland as a student at Pitt, so excited to visit a new location in the South Hills on a recent visit back! I had a free entree coupon for my birthday (pro tip: sign up for their email listings to get said free entree!), so visited the Upper St. Clair restaurant with my mom. This location was much larger than the Oakland and South Side ones, with a nice outdoor patio and extensive indoor seating as well. The set up at the counter is essentially the same, including the signature salad bar, which did not have any of the options compromised at the "satellite" location. Always feel so welcoming when walking in the door!  I always opt for a build-your-own salad, and this time was no different - I got the spinach and kale lettuce base and added on tofu as some protein. Since it was summertime, strawberries and green apples were on the bar, so had to get those. I also included some other basic salad toppings (cucumbers, tomatoes, etc.), but always need to get the roasted beets - these are the finest option on the bar, in my opinion!! I even requested to have double the portion thrown on, they are that good. I topped the salad off with some goat cheese (not often a cheese option!) and a few almonds to bring the whole salad come together. I love that the employees chop the salad for you and mix the dressing in - I always go for small bites and light dressing (pro tip: ask for dressing on the side if you are worried it will be under-dressed), and this time I tried out the poppyseed vinaigrette to round out my summer-themed salad. My salad was dressed, chopped, and topped perfectly, and the flavors I selected made it feel so summery and refreshing, yet so filling and satisfying.   Hello Bistro is likely my favorite fast-casual restaurant in PGH, and I am happy the 'burb locations do not disappoint. Happy to have had another solid experience at Hello, and looking forward to many more trips back when I visit PGH again! (PS please open a location in Columbus!!)

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Build your own salad with kale/spinach mix, tofu, and poppyseed vinnaigrette!

0rRJlVkb9vY7b8DxHMKQIQ.text: Great place for a filling salad. I like that you can create your own, even down to how finely you want it chopped! Tons of toppings to choose from and a wide variety of dressings. Their premade salad suggestions are also great. I've never had any of their other food though, so I can't speak to that. I'd recommend going here for a healthy lunch or a quick dinner.

pUENBtZ06yLP2hKfZlNRBQ.text: Update 8/30/19:  I decided to give this place another try and this time I ordered ahead and it was ready on time and nice and convenient.  I ordered the Cobb salad again and AGAIN there was no chicken! I thought maybe I read the description wrong so I reread it and indeed it did list roasted chicken as part of the salad.  Unbelievable!

MPQtiFLAsXu6mYEon-wrDQ.text: Great salads and french fries, even if the service is a little slow. We enjoyed our time here.

1DW5e3vIUF8twUpfEBQavw.text: The last time we were here, my wife and I both ordered burgers.  I asked for mine to be medium well, and the woman working there said they cook all the burgers to proper temp. and do not cook them to order.  Well, when our burgers arrived, both of them were pink in the middle . . .  We flagged down one of the teens working there and asked him if he thought our burgers were cooked properly, and he said no, and offered to have new ones made for us.  The replacement burgers were a little overcooked in my opinion, but at least they were not pink.     Overall, I still think this place in A-O.K. . . . Cheers!

fcPjmmHplAzpJIbYeGeT0A.text: Bad experience! The only reason for 2 stars is because the salad itself tasted good. Upon arriving I was second in line. I had never been here before so I ordered off of the salad menu. After awkwardly standing there for 5 minutes, and staring at how gross the food prep area was, and the floor.. the girl behind the counter told me to go sit down and they would bring me my food. 20 minutes later (not exaggerating) I walked up to the counter and asked them if they had forgot about my order.... of course they did. It was made, but no one ever brought it to me. Awful experience for me for sure. 1- order online. 2- I won't be back until the food prep area looks better, looks like contaminated food waiting to happen.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Empty, watery vegetables. Disgusting floors.
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

njiqCM6bvOhBnvO4ZbLEJA.text: Excellent. Great salads. Quality ingredients. I have been to 2 locations (south hills and Forbes ave) both we're operating smoothly. Service was quick and efficient. The salad ingredients quality was too notch. You get a big salad for around $10. Can't beat that. I'm definitely coming back.

Kr2m8VPeHEVQzGEpbsyYmg.text: Hello Bistro ended up being pretty much what I expected it to be.  It is pretty much a classier version of Eat'n Park.  Overall it was a nice place to get a good, cheap lunch.    The inside has a nice modern look to it.  The service during our visit was average.  The workers we encountered could have been more helpful for it being our first time.  For my meal I went with the Superburger and fries.  The burger was exactly the same as Eat'n Park, which is what I expected.  As usual, it was very good.  The French fries are really good and very different from Eat'n Park's.  They are skinnier and have a really good seasoning on them.  Another plus of this place was the self dispensing Eat'n Park ranch dressing.  Can't beat that.  I would like to go back to try the salads which looked really good.  Overall it was a pretty decent experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Superburger and fries

iqkhGETvbuYKIAfyZwDTFg.text: Don't think I've ever seen worse customer service. We came in at 5pm on a Sunday evening to grab a couple salads to go for dinner. The restaurant was empty (not another patron in the place) and six people working. We stood and waited to order for at least 3-5 minutes which was confusing (because NO ONE else was there) - a girl asked if we were ready, we said yes, and she walked away to fill herself a drink at the soda station and didn't come back over to help us but talk to another employee about something on her phone instead! Finally - someone came out of the back to help and take our order. A couple employees were bickering right in front of us and appeared visibly tense. After both of our salads were made - we asked for them to-go and the guy chopping didn't want to mess with it so he tossed two lids at my boyfriend who clearly had a full cast on his broken hand and could use help. We again had to ask for a bag and further had to ask for the utensils to be refilled because there were no forks !  As we were walking out, both my boyfriend and I could overhear them making comments.   Management - you need an ADULT in here ! 5 of the 6 were kids - under 21- and the only adult was a cook in the back. They were rude, unprofessional, and less than helpful !!!!!! I frequent many businesses in the Siena plaza and this one is not up to par at all. Very Disappointed !

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

E-I59eHwYI1my0Q2Z8_FGw.text: I've been to hello bistro a few times and each time I love my burger! It's really good and get a black cherry soda! So good! The only thing I would say it's like a Panara bread with ordering and then waiting for it to come up but it takes longer than a Panara. It's a nice place for a quick lunch or dinner.

7c9TbNRG01Mv-EEu3djCiA.text: Good atmosphere and easy to order. Food was ok, had the salad, nothing too special. The burger and fries were delicious though!! Trendy place, but nothing to rave about.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

7cMU6HnG4btEnA8j3QehLw.text: Finally got to try Hello Bistro for lunch! Upon walking in you place your order at the counter and then they give you a number and serve you your food. They have a ton of different salad options, including making your own. I saw probably 50 different toppings you could get on your salad.   They have different featured items and I went with the turkey burger that came with pineapple, arugula, and a chipotle mayo. Unfortunately, they were out of the chipotle mayo which was a bummer. If this is a special featured item you are pushing- I'd like to see them have all of the ingredients. However it was still super tasty and fresh so I was too upset. It was cooked perfectly and had a really good flavor! Sometimes turkey burgers can taste strange but this was the perfect texture and size. My husband had French fries with his burger and they were fresh cut and seasoned perfectly! Did I mention they serve Eat N Park ranch dressing, which is the best!   The best part was our entire lunch was only $15 and we left stuffed! Such a good deal. I will be back soon to try the featured strawberry chicken salad before it disappears after summer!

S5H6jI2EYXII04oJhvJ-pQ.text: So good!! I've never heard of Hello Bistro but I'd been craving a salad all day and it did not disappoint. They have a fabulous selection of fresh and flavorful ingredients, and the citrus lime vinaigrette is FABULOUS! Zesty and delicious. Impressive portions too.

l13tIUPT1mWEcS_jN8EsyA.text: I wanted to call this chain the GOODBYE BISTRO because every time I went to the other locations they were closed early.  Anyway, this is a clean, modern diner where you can build your own expensive salad from a million ingredients or get burgers, grilled cheese or soup.  I got the onion mushroom burger with fries. The burger was ok and my fries were over cooked and over salted and burnt. It was just ok.  If you want to sit in a clean diner in a nice European styled plaza with rich white people listening to retro and Christian rock hits while eating salad then this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

7SGoQmrU-I6Br1a20yemBw.text: We were in the area doing errands and wanted something quick.   We stopped at Hello Bistro and were so happy that we did.   I love that they make the salads (regular salad bars kind of gross me out) and love that it is unlimited toppings.   I made my own salad, everything was fresh and I loved that I got to customize it exactly as I wanted.   My bf built a burger and enjoyed it as well.   We both got an order of fries and they were absolutely delicious. I love fresh cut fries and they were def real fresh cut fries. My favorite part is the big pump of ranch next to the ketchup.   The service was friendly and quick. The restaurant was clean and inviting. The meal was reasonably priced.    We will def be back.

cGXC-l55Ctz0xdyewE03sg.text: I came here today for the Tandoori chicken salad. The other ingredients sounded good and are generally what I like. The neat thing they do is chop the greens into small pieces. That made it easy to eat AND it makes it possible for them to pack a lot of greens into the bowl. It took awhile to eat but wasn't a workout on the jaw since it was chopped. The other ingredients like the beets and avocado were great. There wasn't a lot of chicken but it seemed appropriate for lunch.  I enjoyed this selection a lot and will have it again.  The salad offerings are what make this place stand out to me. Whenever I want a salad for my meal, I will come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. A Tandoori Salad Story - huge, tasty salad.
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Menu side 2
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Menu side 1

0tCgNCY6vumGOY5XX88D2g.text: I love this place for the make your own salads (great ingredients and large selection), but it took me a half hour to get a salad and I still haven't gotten my fries. All of the employees seem maxed out, they need more people to manage each station.

lRbConoo-t9O74tWFOsIaw.text: ! What's not to love? They have MTO salads, delicious, Juicy Burgers, hand-dipped milkshakes, Pepsi products, and green iced tea (which is hard to find).  The GM, Andy, came right over to grret us, shake our hands, and give us a $10 gift card for a future visit. My Hawaii Five-O turkey burger was delicious. It was juicy, plump, perfectly cooked and Anna I'm a delicious fun with a fresh slice of pineapple and melted cheese. French fries, which I did not order, we're $2 extra.

photos.caption: Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. New umbrellas just installed! Taking advantage of nice weather while I can!
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States
Photo of Hello Bistro - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States

xY9taP64R9pqKI39TYktLg.text: I've visited this establishment a few times to date now since there is one in the South Hills. Yay! It's in a good spot that has seemed to grow rapidly with other businesses nearby.  Last nite was the first time I placed an online order and man, I'll tell ya, that is the way to go! Easy peasy! I highly recommend it if you don't don't want to wait since when I've went and ordered at the register, it seemed to take a significant time for "faster burgers and salads."  Last night I ordered the Southern Shrimp salad and it was very good. It was so filling I could only eat half. Today is another day! I also ordered a turkey cheeseburger and it was pretty good, but nothing out of the ordinary. I did try their GF bun last time and it was kind of blah. Otherwise, the salads I've ordered on the menu or customized in the past have been good. The staff members are always friendly, and the place is clean and always lively.
